p: Typical examples of incomplete data are associated with many US regulatory monitoring stations, which are required to operate only during the so-called “ozone season” (i.e., a varying period of several months during the summer depending on state, but also varying over the years). Given the general tendency of ozone levels to be higher in summer than in winter, the evaluation of annual statistics at such sites would provide different results. This can be demonstrated by comparing for example selected percentile values evaluated during the summer months with those evaluated over the full year from a station with full annual coverage ( Figure 5).
